body_html:
@fritzo I think that is a good idea. Especially, because of the fact that natural parameters will be occasionally used, I think it would be better to abstract it away.

We can come with a similar logic as done for kl_divergence for these methods as well by using registries. Please let me know what you think.
body_text:
@fritzo I think that is a good idea. Especially, because of the fact that natural parameters will be occasionally used, I think it would be better to abstract it away.
We can come with a similar logic as done for kl_divergence for these methods as well by using registries. Please let me know what you think.
body:
@fritzo I think that is a good idea. Especially, because of the fact that natural parameters will be occasionally used, I think it would be better to abstract it away.

We can come with a similar logic as done for `kl_divergence` for these methods as well by using registries. Please let me know what you think.
